Title: "[20250902] - Core - User-Enumeration in passkey authentication method"
Description: ""Project: Joomla! SubProject: CMS Impact: Moderate Severity: Low Probability: Low Versions: 4.0.0-4.4.13, 5.0.0-5.3.3 Exploit type: User Enumeration Reported Date: 2025-09-04 Fixed Date: 2025-09-30 CVE Number: CVE-2025-54477 Description Improper handling of authentication requests lead to a user enumeration vector in the passkey authentication method. Affected Installs Joomla! CMS versions 4.0.0-4.4.13, 5.0.0-5.3.3 Solution Upgrade to version 4.4.14 or 5.3.4 Contact The JSST at the Joomla! Security Centre . Reported By: Marco Schubert""

Title: "Some ShareFile customers may be experiencing issues with logging into their ShareFile account"
Description: ""Oct 6 , 16:13 EDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Oct 6 , 16:10 EDT Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue. Oct 6 , 15:58 EDT Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues. Oct 6 , 15:57 EDT Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Oct 6 , 15:56 EDT Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Oct 6 , 13:56 EDT Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue. Oct 6 , 13:33 EDT Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Oct 6 , 12:36 EDT Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Oct 6 , 12:35 EDT Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Oct 6 , 12:29 EDT Investigating - Some ShareFile customers may be experiencing issues with being able to log into their accounts. We are investigating this issue and we will provide updates here as soon as available.""

Title: "Migrating from OpenDNSSEC to BIND 9"
Description: ""With OpenDNSSEC reaching End-of-Life, this article aims to help with the transition to BIND 9 for those who wish to do so. In BIND 9 you can configure a DNSSEC Key and Signing Policy (KASP), allowing you to specify all DNSSEC signing behavior in one place. This is the same approach as with OpenDNSSEC. Migrating should be relatively straightforward. It consists of the following steps: updating your configuration, putting the OpenDNSSEC settings into named.conf importing keys, generating key file ...""

Title: "[20250901] - Core - Inadequate content filtering within the checkAttribute filter code"
Description: ""Project: Joomla! / Joomla! Framework SubProject: CMS / filter Impact: Moderate Severity: Moderate Probability: Moderate Versions: 3.0.0-3.10.20-elts, 4.0.0-4.4.13, 5.0.0-5.3.3 Exploit type: XSS Reported Date: 2025-08-03 Fixed Date: 2025-09-30 CVE Number: CVE-2025-54476 Description Inadequate content filtering within the checkAttribute methods leads to XSS vulnerabilities in various components. Affected Installs Joomla! CMS versions 3.0.0-3.10.20-elts, 4.0.0-4.4.13, 5.0.0-5.3.3 Solution Upgrade to version 4.4.14 or 5.3.4 Contact The JSST at the Joomla! Security Centre . Reported By: Flydragon, Poi, Cwy, Xtrimi""

Title: "[製品]Trend Micro Apex Central 2019 Patch 10(ビルド 7141) 公開のお知らせ:2025/10/07 11:00:00"
